title: Review: Mood Indigo – People EP
body:
Having announced his arrival on the scene with the gorgeous instrumental _[Dive](http://admin.crackintheroad.com/music/17042-new-mood-indigo-dive/)_, a really vivid, **Gold Panda**\-esque number, fusing 80’s hip-hop vibes with more modern production elements, it served as a fitting, if not slightly mystical introduction to the music of the Boston beatmaker. Now, with his debut EP, _**People**_ available, it appears **Mood Indigo** is spreading his wings, and unveiling more of his characteristics and personality, most notably through the addition of his own vocals.

Opening with the bizarrely disjointed yet wonderfully colourful _Bird Nest_, **_People EP_** is a worthwhile foray into the music of **Mood Indigo**, showcasing a more pop orientated side to the artist than found on _Dive_. Largely due to the inclusion of vocals, the pronounced hip-hop beats lend themselves to the usage of headphones, especially on _Sun Brother_, a delicate if not desolate track, based around the sampling of an 80’s style soul song. Personal favourite _Blue Spring_ is one of the most deliciously textured pop songs you’re likely to hear this year, wrapped up nicely with a stunning set of Midi percussion. _**People**_ may not quite be the debut release we expected from **Mood Indigo**, however it’s an intriguing composition and certainly marks the Boston musician out as a one for the future. Stream the entire EP below.
